name: clownish
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
similar to a clown (= someone who entertains people by wearing funny clothes with a painted face, and making people laugh): He had learned to hide his sensitive, anxious nature behind clownish behaviour. There was much about her performance that was completely clownish.
More examplesFewer examplesIn person he seems calmer and wiser than his clownish public persona would suggest. His characters, though often clownish, are rarely cartoonish. The protesters were led through the city streets by a clownish figure on stilts.
